instructions.step: Heat oil in a pan and cook the beef tapa until browned and tender.
Prepare garlic fried rice and fry eggs to your preference.
Assemble a plate with tapa, sinangag, and egg (silog).
Serve with vinegar sauce on the side if desired.
Boil longganisa in a small amount of water until water evaporates.
Let longganisa fry in its own oil until cooked and caramelized.
Prepare garlic fried rice and fry eggs.
Serve longganisa with sinangag and egg.
Fry the marinated bangus in hot oil until crispy and golden.
Prepare garlic fried rice and fry eggs.
Serve bangus with sinangag and egg.
Boil glutinous rice in water until soft and porridge-like.
Stir in cocoa powder and sugar until well mixed.
Cook for another 5–10 minutes until thickened.
Serve hot with a drizzle of condensed milk.
Mix flour, sugar, salt, and yeast in a bowl.
Gradually add milk and melted butter; knead until smooth.
Let dough rise for 1 hour or until doubled in size.
Shape into small balls and roll in breadcrumbs.
Let rise again for 30 minutes.
Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 15–20 minutes until golden brown.
Serve warm.

ingredients.item: Toasted garlic and spring onions for garnish

instructions.step: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until aromatic.
Add chicken pieces and cook until no longer pink.
Add rice and stir to coat with oil.
Pour in chicken broth and simmer until rice is soft and porridge-like.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Serve hot with toasted garlic, spring onions, and calamansi.
Fry Spam slices in a pan until crispy.
Prepare garlic fried rice and fry eggs.
Assemble Spam, sinangag, and egg on a plate.
Serve hot.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the milkfish until crispy and golden brown.
Drain on paper towels to remove excess oil.
Serve with vinegar dipping sauce and garlic rice.
Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add beef and cook until browned.
Pour soy sauce, sugar, and black pepper; mix well.
Pour beef broth and simmer until beef is tender.
Serve with garlic fried rice and a small bowl of beef soup.
Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add corned beef and cook for 5 minutes.
Prepare garlic fried rice and fry eggs.
Serve corned beef with sinangag and egg.

ingredients.item: 1 kg pork belly (or pork shoulder), cut into chunks
1 tsp whole black peppercorns (or 1/2 tsp ground black pepper)
1 tbsp brown sugar (optional, for a slightly sweet touch)

instructions.step: In a bowl, combine pork, soy sauce, half of the crushed garlic, and pepper. Marinate for at least 30 minutes (best if 1–2 hours).
Heat oil in a pan. Sauté the remaining garlic (and onions if using) until fragrant and slightly golden.
Add the marinated pork pieces into the pan. Cook until they are lightly browned on the edges.
Pour the marinade into the pan along with water. Stir and add the bay leaves.
Bring to a boil, then lower the heat. Cover and let it simmer for about 40–50 minutes, or until the pork becomes tender.
Pour in the vinegar. Let it boil for about 3–5 minutes without stirring to cook off the vinegar's strong taste.
Stir gently. Add sugar if you want a little sweetness. Taste and adjust seasoning if needed (you can add a little more salt or soy sauce).
Simmer uncovered until the sauce is slightly thickened, depending on how saucy or dry you want your adobo.
Serve hot with steamed rice!

ingredients.item: 1 kg chicken, cut into serving pieces
2 cups green papaya or chayote, sliced

instructions.step: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until aromatic.
Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned.
Pour fish sauce and stir well.
Add water and chicken broth; bring to a boil.
Simmer until chicken is cooked through (around 25 minutes).
Add green papaya and cook until tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add spinach or malunggay leaves. Cook for 2 minutes.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add beef and cook until browned.
Pour tomato sauce and beef broth. Bring to a boil.
Simmer until beef is tender (around 1 hour).
Add potatoes and carrots. Cook until tender.
Mix in liver spread and bell peppers.
Simmer for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with rice.

ingredients.item: 1 kg pork belly, cut into chunks
5 pcs string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces
Salt or fish sauce to taste

instructions.step: Boil pork in water until scum rises; discard scum.
Add onion and tomatoes. Simmer for 45 minutes.
Add radish, eggplant, and string beans. Cook until tender.
Add sinigang mix and green chili.
Season with salt or fish sauce.
Add kangkong leaves just before turning off the heat.
Serve hot with rice.

ingredients.item: 5 pcs long green chilies, sliced diagonally

instructions.step: Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add pork and cook until lightly browned.
Stir in shrimp paste and chilies.
Pour coconut milk and simmer until pork is tender.
Add coconut cream and cook until sauce thickens.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 1/2 cup lechon sauce (Mang Tomas or homemade)

instructions.step: In a pot, combine lechon, vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, bay leaves, and water.
Bring to a boil without stirring.
Simmer until lechon is tender (about 30 minutes).
Add lechon sauce and continue simmering until sauce thickens.
Season with salt and pepper if needed.
Serve hot with rice.
Sauté garlic and onion until softened.
Add pork and cook until browned.
Pour in soy sauce and tomato sauce. Stir well.
Add potatoes, carrots, and liver. Simmer until tender.
Mix in bell peppers and cook for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve with steamed rice.
Boil mung beans in water until soft (about 40 minutes).
Sauté garlic, onion, and tomato in a separate pan.
Add pork and cook until lightly browned.
Mix pork into the mung beans pot.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Add spinach or ampalaya leaves before serving.
Serve hot.
Grill or boil the eggplants until the skin is charred.
Peel off the skin carefully while keeping the eggplant whole.
Flatten the eggplant with a fork.
Beat the eggs with salt and pepper.
Dip each eggplant in the beaten eggs.
Fry the eggplant in hot oil until golden brown.
Serve hot with ketchup or rice.

ingredients.item: 1 kg beef brisket, cut into chunks

instructions.step: Heat oil and sauté garlic and onions until fragrant.
Add beef and cook until browned.
Pour in tomato sauce and beef broth. Simmer until beef is tender (about 1 hour).
Add liver spread, potatoes, and carrots. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Mix in green peas and bell peppers. Simmer for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 1 kg chicken, cut into serving pieces

instructions.step: Heat oil and sauté garlic and onion until translucent.
Add chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Pour in tomato sauce and water. Simmer until chicken is tender.
Add potatoes and carrots. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Mix in green peas and bell pepper. Simmer for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 1 kg pork belly, cut into chunks

instructions.step: Boil pork in water with onions and tomatoes until pork is tender.
Add radish, sitaw, and eggplant. Cook until vegetables are half-cooked.
Pour in sinigang mix and stir well.
Add kangkong last and cook for 1–2 minutes.
Season with fish sauce.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 1 cup string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces

instructions.step: Fry pork until browned and crispy. Set aside.
Sauté garlic, onion, and tomatoes until soft.
Add bagoong and mix well.
Add squash and water. Cook until slightly tender.
Add string beans, eggplant, and ampalaya. Simmer until cooked but still crisp.
Top with fried pork before serving.
Marinate beef in soy sauce, calamansi juice, and garlic for at least 30 minutes.
Heat oil and fry onion rings. Set aside.
In the same pan, fry beef slices until cooked.
Pour remaining marinade and simmer beef until tender.
Top with fried onions before serving.
Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer.
Add shrimp and cook until it turns pink.
Pour coconut cream and continue simmering until thickened.
Season with salt and pepper. Add chili if desired.
Serve hot with rice.
Arrange bangus, eggplant, onion, ginger, and garlic in a pot.
Pour vinegar and water over the ingredients.
Season with salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil without stirring.
Simmer until fish is cooked and flavors are absorbed.
Serve hot with rice.
Boil beef until tender. Set aside broth.
Sauté garlic and onion, add beef, then tomato sauce.
Add broth back in and simmer.
Add sweet potatoes, saba bananas, and green beans.
When vegetables are almost cooked, add cabbage and pechay.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot.
In a pot, arrange taro leaves without stirring once coconut milk is added.
Pour coconut milk and add garlic, onion, ginger, and dried seafood.
Simmer on low heat without stirring until leaves absorb the coconut milk.
Add coconut cream and chilies, then cook until oil surfaces.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with rice.

ingredients.item: 1 kg oxtail (or beef shank/tripe), cut into pieces
1/4 cup ground toasted rice (optional, for thickening)
1 bundle string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces

instructions.step: Boil oxtail until tender (about 1–1.5 hours). Set aside broth.
Heat oil in a large pan. Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add boiled meat and some broth. Simmer.
Stir in peanut butter until fully dissolved.
Add ground rice to thicken the sauce (optional).
Add vegetables (string beans, banana heart, eggplant) and cook until tender.
Add pechay last and cook for 1–2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with bagoong on the side.
Marinate pork belly in soy sauce, calamansi juice, garlic, pepper, and salt for at least 1 hour.
Grill over hot charcoal until fully cooked and slightly charred.
Serve with dipping sauce or rice.

ingredients.item: 1 whole chicken, cut into serving pieces

instructions.step: Marinate chicken in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, sugar, salt, and pepper for at least 2 hours.
Grill over medium heat until chicken is cooked through and slightly charred.
Serve hot with dipping sauce.
Marinate chicken in vinegar, calamansi, garlic, ginger, salt, and pepper for several hours.
Grill while basting with annatto oil until fully cooked and golden.
Serve with sinamak (spiced vinegar).
Stuff pig with lemongrass, garlic, and onions.
Season the skin with salt and pepper.
Roast over charcoal while turning continuously until skin is crisp and meat is tender.
Serve during special occasions with liver sauce.
Boil pork belly with salt until tender. Let it cool and dry.
Deep-fry until golden and crispy.
Serve with liver sauce or vinegar dip.
Boil pork leg with spices until tender. Dry thoroughly.
Deep-fry until skin is golden and crisp.
Serve with soy-vinegar dipping sauce.
Boil pork belly until tender. Let it dry completely.
Deep-fry twice until very crispy.
Serve with bagoong or vinegar with garlic and chili.
Sauté garlic and onions. Add pork and cook until tender.
Add vinegar and simmer. Stir in pork blood while mixing continuously.
Season and simmer until thick. Serve with puto.
Combine pork and tofu in a bowl.
Mix vinegar, soy sauce, onions, and chili for the dressing.
Pour over and toss. Serve chilled or at room temperature.
Sauté garlic, onion, and tomatoes.
Add pork and cook until lightly browned.
Stir in shrimp paste, vinegar, and sugar. Simmer until tender.
Sauté garlic and onion. Add squid and cook briefly.
Add vinegar, soy sauce, bay leaves, and pepper. Simmer until done.
Sauté garlic and onion. Add pork and liver.
Pour vinegar and soy sauce. Simmer until meat is tender.
Add bell pepper. Cook briefly and serve.
Boil and clean beef innards thoroughly.
Sauté with garlic, onion, and ginger.
Add vinegar and bile. Simmer and season to taste.
Combine all ingredients and simmer until meat is tender.
Add banana blossoms. Cook until sauce thickens.
Marinate goat meat in vinegar and spices.
Sauté with garlic, onion, and tomato sauce.
Add vegetables, liver spread, and cheese. Simmer until tender.
Clean and dice the fish. Rinse in water, drain.
In a bowl, mix fish with vinegar and let sit for 10 minutes.
Drain excess vinegar, then add onion, ginger, chili, salt, and pepper.
Mix well and chill before serving.
Clean gabi leaves and set aside.
Wrap fish, garlic, onion, and spices in gabi leaves.
Arrange wrapped fish in a pot. Pour coconut milk over it.
Simmer until leaves are soft and fish is cooked.
Mix pork/shrimp with garlic, onion, and seasoning.
Wrap the mixture in gabi leaves.
Arrange in a pot and pour in coconut milk.
Simmer until tender and flavorful.

ingredients.item: Salt, chili, and pepper to taste

instructions.step: Boil and flake stingray meat.
Sauté garlic and ginger in a pan.
Add stingray and coconut milk. Simmer until thickened.
Add malunggay and season. Simmer briefly and serve.

ingredients.item: Salt, pepper, and chili to taste

instructions.step: Stuff tilapia with onion, tomato, and seasoning.
Wrap each fish in gabi leaves.
Arrange in a pot and pour coconut milk.
Simmer until fish and leaves are cooked through.
Clean and boil the pork bulaklak with water, salt, and vinegar until tender.
Drain and dry thoroughly.
Deep fry until crispy and golden brown.
Serve with spiced vinegar dip.

ingredients.item: Chicken blood, coagulated and cut into cubes

instructions.step: Boil coagulated chicken blood cubes in water with vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, bay leaf, salt, and pepper.
Let cool and skewer the cubes.
Grill over charcoal until slightly crisp outside.
Serve with vinegar dipping sauce.
Clean and boil chicken feet in a mix of soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaf, salt, and pepper until tender.
Let cool and skewer.
Grill until crispy and golden brown.
Serve with spicy vinegar sauce.
Clean intestines thoroughly and boil with vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, and bay leaf.
Skewer and grill over medium heat until slightly crispy.
Serve hot with dipping sauce.
Prepare batter with flour, cornstarch, water, food coloring, salt, and pepper.
Coat boiled eggs in batter.
Deep-fry until crispy and golden orange.
Serve with spiced vinegar or sweet chili sauce.
Make a batter using flour, cornstarch, food coloring, water, salt, and pepper.
Dip the eggs into the batter.
Deep-fry until golden orange and crispy.
Serve with vinegar or sweet sauce.
Sauté garlic and onion. Add meat and cook until tender.
Add vegetables and cook briefly.
Add soy sauce and broth. Bring to a boil.
Add noodles and cook until broth is absorbed.
Serve hot with calamansi.
Soak rice noodles in water until soft. Drain and set aside.
Sauté garlic and onion. Add meat and shrimp, cook until done.
Add vegetables and stir-fry briefly.
Pour in soy sauce and broth. Let it simmer.
Add noodles and toss until liquid is absorbed and noodles are cooked.
Serve with calamansi on the side.
Cook noodles until soft, then drain.
Sauté garlic and onion, then add seafood and season with fish sauce and annatto oil.
Mix sauce with noodles until evenly coated.
Top with eggs, chicharon, green onions, and serve with calamansi.
Cook rice noodles and set aside.
Sauté garlic and onion, then add pork and shrimp broth.
Add annatto and thicken with flour or cornstarch slurry.
Pour sauce over noodles and top with shrimp, eggs, chicharon, and green onions.
Serve with calamansi.

ingredients.item: Lucban miki noodles (or thick egg noodles)

instructions.step: Sauté garlic and onion, add pork and shrimp, and cook thoroughly.
Add vegetables, then soy sauce and a bit of vinegar.
Mix in noodles and cook until well incorporated and soft.
Serve on banana leaves and eat without utensils (habhab style).

ingredients.item: Chicken or beef (boiled and shredded or sliced)

instructions.step: Boil meat until tender and set aside the broth.
Cook noodles according to package instructions.
In a bowl, add noodles, meat, and egg.
Pour hot broth and garnish with fried garlic and spring onions.
Season with salt, pepper, or fish sauce.
Sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add pork and cook until browned.
Stir in liver, then soy sauce. Cook for 2 minutes.
Pour in pork broth and bring to a boil.
Add carrots and miki noodles. Simmer for 5–10 minutes.
Pour in diluted cornstarch to thicken the soup.
Drizzle beaten egg while stirring.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with calamansi and soy sauce.
Sauté garlic and onion, add pork and liver. Cook until tender.
Add soy sauce and shrimp paste, then broth. Simmer.
In a separate pot, blanch noodles and place in serving bowl.
Pour broth with meat over noodles.
Top with crushed chicharon and chopped spring onions.
Serve hot.
Boil pork intestines until tender. Discard water.
Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger.
Add pork and intestines. Cook until browned.
Pour water and simmer until pork is tender.
Add chili leaves last and cook for 1 minute.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot.
Soak sotanghon in water until soft, then drain.
Sauté garlic and onion. Add chicken and cook through.
Add broth and bring to a boil.
Add vegetables and simmer until tender.
Stir in sotanghon and fish sauce.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with spring onions on top.

ingredients.item: 1 kg beef shank with bone marrow
1 corn on the cob, cut into 3 pieces
2 cups string beans (sitaw), cut into 2-inch pieces

instructions.step: In a large pot, bring water to a boil and add the beef shank. Simmer for 1.5 hours until the meat is tender and marrow is soft.
Add onion, garlic, and fish sauce. Continue simmering for another 30 minutes.
Add potatoes, carrots, corn, and string beans. Cook until the vegetables are tender.
Add pechay last and cook for 2 more minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with steamed rice and fish sauce with calamansi on the side.

ingredients.item: 1 bundle string beans (sitaw), cut into 2-inch pieces

instructions.step: In a large pot, boil beef shank in water for 1.5 hours until tender.
Add onion, garlic, corn, and potatoes. Simmer until vegetables are tender.
Add string beans and pechay. Continue cooking for another 3-5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with fish sauce and calamansi on the side.

ingredients.item: 1 bundle string beans (sitaw), cut into 2-inch pieces

instructions.step: In a large pot, boil pork ribs in water for about 1.5 hours until tender.
Add onion, garlic, corn, and potatoes. Simmer until vegetables are soft.
Add string beans and pechay. Cook for an additional 3-5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with fish sauce and calamansi on the side.

ingredients.item: 1 packet sinigang mix or tamarind paste
1 bundle string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces

instructions.step: In a large pot, bring water to a boil and add onion, tomatoes, and green peppers. Simmer for 5-10 minutes.
Add the sinigang mix or tamarind paste and stir until dissolved.
Add shrimp and cook for 3-5 minutes until shrimp turns pink and tender.
Add string beans and kangkong. Cook for another 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 500g bangus (milkfish) or any firm white fish, cut into steaks
1 packet sinigang mix or tamarind paste
1 bundle string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces

instructions.step: In a large pot, bring water to a boil and add onion, tomatoes, and green peppers. Simmer for 5-10 minutes.
Add the sinigang mix or tamarind paste and stir until dissolved.
Add the fish steaks and cook for 5-7 minutes until fish is cooked through.
Add string beans and kangkong. Cook for another 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 1 packet sinigang mix or tamarind paste
1 bundle string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces

instructions.step: In a large pot, bring water to a boil and add onion, tomatoes, and sinigang mix or tamarind paste. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in miso paste and dissolve it completely.
Add bangus and cook for 5-7 minutes until fish is cooked through.
Add string beans and kangkong. Cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
Marinate the bangus in vinegar, salt, and pepper for about 10 minutes.
Fry the bangus until golden brown and crispy.
Cook garlic rice by sautéing garlic in oil, then mixing it with leftover rice.
Fry eggs sunny-side up.
Assemble the dish by placing the garlic rice, bangus, and fried egg on a plate.
Serve with extra vinegar on the side.
Fry the tocino in a pan until caramelized and cooked through.
Prepare garlic rice by sautéing garlic in oil, then mixing it with leftover rice.
Fry eggs sunny-side up.
Assemble the dish by placing garlic rice, tocino, and fried egg on a plate.
Serve with vinegar on the side if desired.
Fry the longganisa until golden brown and cooked through.
Prepare garlic rice by sautéing garlic in oil, then mixing it with leftover rice.
Fry eggs sunny-side up.
Assemble the dish by placing garlic rice, longganisa, and fried egg on a plate.
Serve with extra vinegar or tomato slices on the side.
Fry or grill the chicken until cooked through.
Prepare garlic rice by sautéing garlic in oil, then mixing it with leftover rice.
Fry eggs sunny-side up.
Assemble the dish by placing garlic rice, chicken, and fried egg on a plate.
Serve with vinegar on the side if desired.
In a bowl, mix all the ingredients together until well combined.
Form the mixture into a log and wrap tightly in foil.
Steam for 1 hour or bake at 350°F (175°C) for 1 hour.
Allow to cool before slicing into rounds and serving.
Lay out the beef slices and arrange the filling (carrots, pickles, ham, cheese, and eggs) in the center.
Roll the beef tightly and secure with kitchen twine.
Brown the morcon in a pan and then simmer in sauce for 1.5 hours.
Serve hot, sliced into rounds.
Mix all ingredients in a large bowl and form into a loaf shape.
Steam for 1 hour or bake in the oven at 350°F (175°C) for 1 hour.
Allow to cool before slicing and serving.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl until well combined.
Form into a loaf and bake at 350°F (175°C) for 1 hour.
Allow to cool before slicing and serving.
Stuff the bangus with the breadcrumb mixture and secure with toothpicks.
Fry the stuffed bangus until golden brown.
Serve hot with vinegar and soy sauce on the side.
Stuff the deboned chicken with the ground pork mixture, including onions, peas, carrots, and breadcrumbs.
Sew up the chicken or tie with kitchen twine to secure the stuffing.
Fry until golden brown and cooked through.
Allow to cool before slicing and serving.
Mix ground pork, onions, carrots, garlic, egg, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Place a spoonful of the mixture onto a spring roll wrapper and roll tightly, sealing the ends with water.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the lumpia until golden brown and crispy.
Drain excess oil and serve with sweet chili sauce.

ingredients.item: 1/2 cup sautéed vegetables (bean sprouts, carrots, cabbage)
1/4 cup cooked shrimp or pork, chopped

instructions.step: Sauté vegetables and shrimp/pork in oil. Season with soy sauce, sugar, and vinegar.
Place a spoonful of the vegetable mixture in a lumpia wrapper, then sprinkle with crushed peanuts.
Roll the wrapper tightly and serve with a sweet garlic sauce.
Mix shrimp, grated sweet potato, flour, egg, bean sprouts, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Heat oil in a pan and drop spoonfuls of the mixture into the oil, flattening them slightly.
Fry until golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Drain on paper towels and serve with vinegar dipping sauce.

ingredients.item: 1/2 cup small shrimp, peeled and deveined

instructions.step: Mix shrimp, cornstarch, egg, grated sweet potato, bean sprouts, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Heat oil in a pan and drop spoonfuls of the mixture into the oil, flattening them slightly.
Fry until golden brown and crispy on both sides.
Drain on paper towels and serve with vinegar dipping sauce.
Sauté garlic and onions until fragrant.
Add ground pork and cook until browned.
Add sliced sayote and cook for 5-7 minutes until tender.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with rice.

ingredients.item: 1 medium upo (bottle gourd), peeled and sliced

instructions.step: Sauté garlic and onions until fragrant.
Add ground pork and cook until browned.
Add sliced upo and cook for 5-7 minutes until tender.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with rice.
Sauté garlic and onions until fragrant.
Add ground pork and cook until browned.
Add sliced ampalaya and cook for 5-7 minutes until tender.
Season with soy sauce, salt, and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with rice.
Sauté garlic, onions, and chili peppers until fragrant.
Add ground pork and cook until browned.
Add long green beans and cook for 5 minutes.
Add coconut milk, season with salt and pepper, and cook until the sauce thickens.
Serve hot with rice.

ingredients.item: 1/4 cup sitaw (string beans), cut into pieces

instructions.step: Boil fish in water until cooked.
Add the vegetables, fish sauce, salt, and pepper.
Simmer until the vegetables are tender.
Serve hot with rice.

ingredients.item: 1/4 cup string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces

instructions.step: Boil the fish in water for 10 minutes or until cooked.
Add the vegetables and cook for an additional 10 minutes or until tender.
Season with shrimp paste, salt, and pepper.
Serve hot with rice.
Grill or roast the eggplants until the skin is charred and the flesh is soft.
Peel the skin off and mash the eggplant flesh in a bowl.
Add the chopped tomato, onion, fish sauce, vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Mix thoroughly and serve chilled.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Let sit for 15-20 minutes for the flavors to meld.
Serve chilled.

ingredients.item: 1 kg fish (bangus or tilapia), cleaned and gutted

instructions.step: Clean the fish and rub with salt, then stuff with cooked rice.
Wrap the fish in a clean cloth and place in a container.
Leave to ferment for 2 days, then soak in vinegar and sugar mixture for additional flavor.
Serve cold or at room temperature with steamed rice.

ingredients.item: 1/2 kg beef sirloin or tapa cut

instructions.step: Marinate the beef in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, sugar, salt, and pepper for 3-4 hours.
Grill the marinated beef until cooked to your desired doneness.
Serve with steamed rice and vinegar dipping sauce.
Marinate the carabao beef in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, sugar, salt, and pepper for 3-4 hours.
Grill the marinated beef until tender and cooked to your desired doneness.
Serve with steamed rice and a vinegar dipping sauce.
Cook chicken pieces in a pan until browned.
Make a sauce by melting butter, adding flour to form a roux, then adding milk, chicken broth, and seasoning with salt and pepper.
Add the cooked chicken and vegetables, simmer for 10-15 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Serve hot with rice.
Sauté onions and garlic until fragrant, then add chicken pieces and cook until browned.
Add curry powder, carrots, potatoes, and bell peppers.
Pour in coconut milk and cook until the chicken is tender and the sauce has thickened.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with rice.

ingredients.item: 1/2 kg pork lungs and heart, chopped

instructions.step: Sauté onions and garlic in oil until fragrant.
Add chopped pork lungs and heart, cooking until browned.
Add vinegar, soy sauce, and ground pepper. Let simmer until cooked through.
Serve hot with rice.

ingredients.item: 1/2 kg beef (sirloin or tenderloin), thinly sliced

instructions.step: In a pan, sauté garlic and onions in oil until fragrant.
Add the beef slices and cook until browned.
Pour in soy sauce, vinegar, and ground pepper. Cook for 10 minutes until the beef is tender.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
Sauté garlic and onions until fragrant.
Add pork, chicken, and shrimp and cook until browned.
Mix in the rice noodles, soy sauce, oyster sauce, and seasoning.
Simmer until noodles are cooked and absorbed the sauce.
Top with chicharrón before serving. Serve hot.
Sauté garlic and onions in oil until fragrant.
Add pork, beef, and chicken. Cook until browned.
Add soy sauce and vinegar, simmering for a few minutes.
Add egg noodles, stirring to combine with the sauce and meat.
Top with chicharrón before serving. Serve hot.
Cook glutinous rice in coconut milk, sugar, and salt until rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed.
Transfer to a greased baking dish and press down to smooth the surface.
Top with grated coconut and drizzle with condensed milk.
Bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for 30 minutes, or until golden brown on top.
Serve warm or chilled.
Rinse glutinous rice thoroughly and cook in coconut milk and lye water.
Stir until the rice becomes sticky and the liquid is absorbed.
Wrap portions of rice in banana leaves and steam for about 30 minutes.
Serve with sugar or coconut jam.
Cook glutinous rice with coconut milk, sugar, and salt until sticky and absorbed.
Wrap portions of rice in banana leaves and steam for 30-45 minutes.
Serve warm with sugar or coconut jam.
Combine glutinous rice flour, sugar, coconut milk, salt, and water in a pot.
Cook over medium heat while stirring constantly until it thickens and forms a dough-like consistency.
Pour into a greased dish and let cool.
Slice and serve.
Combine glutinous rice flour, sugar, coconut milk, and salt in a pot.
Cook over medium heat, stirring continuously until it thickens.
Transfer to a greased dish and top with grated coconut.
Let it cool, then slice and serve.
Mix glutinous rice flour, coconut milk, sugar, and salt in a pot.
Divide the mixture into portions and color each portion with different food coloring.
Steam each colored mixture in layers until firm, about 20 minutes per layer.
Top with grated coconut before serving.
Mix rice flour, brown sugar, lye water, and water in a bowl.
Pour into individual molds and steam for 30 minutes or until firm.
Top with grated coconut before serving.
Mix rice flour, sugar, coconut milk, baking powder, and salt in a bowl.
Pour into individual molds and steam for 20 minutes or until firm.
Serve warm.
Mix glutinous rice flour, sugar, coconut milk, salt, and food coloring if desired.
Steam mixture in molds for 20-30 minutes or until firm.
Top with grated coconut before serving.
Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Line baking pans with banana leaves.
Mix rice flour, sugar, coconut milk, salt, and eggs until smooth.
Pour the batter into the prepared pans and top with sliced salted duck eggs and cheese.
Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Serve warm.
Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a baking dish.
Mix grated cassava, coconut milk, sugar, condensed milk, and evaporated milk until smooth.
Pour into the prepared dish and bake for 30-40 minutes, or until golden brown on top.
Top with grated cheese and serve warm or chilled.
Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a llanera (flan mold) with sugar and caramelize it.
Mix egg yolks, condensed milk, evaporated milk, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Pour the mixture into the mold and cover with aluminum foil.
Bake in a water bath for 45 minutes or until set. Cool before serving.
Cook mashed ube with coconut milk, sugar, butter, and condensed milk in a pan over medium heat.
Stir constantly until it thickens and becomes sticky.
Transfer to a greased dish and let cool before serving.
Rinse glutinous rice and cook in coconut milk until the rice is tender.
In a separate pan, melt brown sugar with salt and coconut milk until it forms a syrup.
Mix the syrup with the cooked rice and stir until thickened.
Transfer to a banana leaf-lined dish, let it cool, then slice and serve.
Mix glutinous rice flour, coconut milk, sugar, and salt in a pot over medium heat.
Add jackfruit, sago pearls, and sweet potato, and simmer until everything is cooked through.
Serve warm.
Cook sticky rice in coconut milk, sugar, and salt until tender.
Add corn kernels and simmer until the mixture thickens.
Serve warm or chilled.
Cook jackfruit, sweet potato, taro, and sago pearls in coconut milk and sugar until tender.
Simmer until the mixture thickens.
Serve warm or chilled.
Roll banana slices and jackfruit (if using) in spring roll wrappers and sprinkle with brown sugar.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the turon until golden brown.
Drain excess oil and serve warm.
Mix the mashed bananas with flour, sugar, salt, and water until smooth.
Heat oil in a pan and drop spoonfuls of the batter into the hot oil.
Fry until golden brown on both sides. Drain excess oil on paper towels.
Serve warm.
Coat the bananas with brown sugar until well covered.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the coated bananas until caramelized and golden brown.
Drain excess oil and serve warm.

ingredients.item: 5 pieces sweet potatoes (camote), peeled and sliced

instructions.step: Coat the sweet potato slices with brown sugar.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the coated sweet potato slices until golden brown and caramelized.
Drain excess oil and serve warm.
Place the bananas in a pan and add enough water to cover them.
Stir in the brown sugar and vanilla extract (if using) and cook over medium heat until the sugar caramelizes and the bananas become tender.
Serve warm as a dessert.
Cook the sliced bao in a pan with water until tender.
Stir in the sugar and cook until the mixture becomes sticky.
Top with latik (coconut curds) and serve warm.
Mix glutinous rice flour and water to form a dough.
Divide the dough into small portions and shape them into flat discs.
Boil water in a pot and drop the discs into the boiling water. Once they float, they are cooked.
Drain the discs and roll them in sugar, toasted sesame seeds, and grated coconut before serving.
In a pot, combine coconut milk, sugar, and cornstarch and cook over low heat while stirring constantly.
Once the mixture thickens, pour into a greased dish and let it cool.
Top with roasted peanuts and serve chilled.
Boil the tapioca pearls in water until translucent, then set aside.
In a separate pan, heat brown sugar and a small amount of water to make syrup.
To serve, place silken tofu in a cup, top with tapioca pearls, pour over syrup, and add vanilla extract if desired.

ingredients.item: 1 cup sweet corn kernels (canned or fresh)

instructions.step: In a bowl, combine sweet corn with sugar and milk. Stir to combine.
Top with shaved ice and drizzle with condensed milk if desired.
Serve immediately.

ingredients.item: 5 pieces saba bananas, peeled and sliced

instructions.step: In a bowl, combine sliced saba bananas with sugar and milk. Stir to combine.
Top with shaved ice and drizzle with condensed milk if desired.
Serve immediately.

ingredients.item: 1/4 cup sweetened beans (red beans, mung beans)

instructions.step: Layer the shaved ice, sweetened beans, fruits, leche flan, and ube ice cream in a tall glass.
Drizzle milk and sprinkle sugar over the top.
Mix well before serving.
Cook the glutinous rice in coconut milk and sugar until tender.
Once cooked, stir in the salt and top with grated coconut.
Serve warm or cold.
Boil the corn kernels in water until tender, then drain.
Top with grated coconut, sugar, and a pinch of salt.
Serve as a snack or side dish.

ingredients.item: 4 pieces saba bananas, boiled and mashed

instructions.step: Mash the boiled bananas and mix with grated coconut, sugar, and salt.
Shape into small portions and serve as a snack.
Mix the glutinous cornmeal with sugar, salt, and coconut milk until smooth.
Wrap the mixture in banana leaves and steam for about 30-45 minutes.
Serve warm.
In a pot, combine pork, kadyos, jackfruit, onion, and tomatoes. Add water and bring to a boil.
Simmer for 1 hour until pork is tender.
Season with fish sauce, salt, and add chili peppers to taste.
Serve hot with rice.
Saute onion, tomato, and garlic in oil until fragrant.
Add chicken pieces and cook until browned.
Pour in coconut milk, water, soy sauce, and chili flakes. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice.
Marinate pork belly in soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, ginger, paprika, salt, and pepper for 30 minutes.
Grill the pork on medium heat, basting with annatto oil until cooked and slightly charred.
Serve with rice and dipping sauce.
In a pot, brown the pork belly chunks over medium heat.
Add soy sauce, vinegar, brown sugar, garlic, onions, and five-spice powder. Simmer for 1-2 hours until pork is tender.
Serve with rice.
Saute onion, garlic, and tomatoes in oil until soft.
Add pork and shrimp paste. Cook until pork is browned.
Pour in water, simmer for 45 minutes until pork is tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice.

ingredients.item: 1 lb beef (shank or tail, cut into pieces)

instructions.step: In a pot, sauté onion and garlic until fragrant.
Add beef pieces and cook until browned. Add soy sauce, vinegar, peppercorns, and bay leaf. Stir to combine.
Pour in water and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer for 1.5-2 hours until beef is tender.
Stir in beans and cook for another 30 minutes. Season with salt to taste.
Serve with rice.
In a pot, sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant.
Add chicken and cook until lightly browned.
Stir in coconut milk, fish sauce, turmeric, cumin, water, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer.
Simmer for 30-40 minutes until chicken is tender and the sauce thickens.
Serve with rice.
In a pan, sauté onion and garlic in oil until softened. Add ground meat and cook until browned.
Season with soy sauce and sugar. Stir to combine, and cook for another 5 minutes.
Lay a banana leaf on a flat surface. Place a spoonful of steamed rice and the meat mixture in the center.
Wrap the rice and meat tightly in the banana leaf and serve.

ingredients.item: 1 lb beef or chicken (cut into pieces)

instructions.step: Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger in oil until fragrant.
Add meat and cook until browned. Stir in soy sauce, fish sauce, cumin powder, and black pepper.
Pour in water and simmer for 45 minutes or until meat is tender.
Stir in coconut milk and cook for another 10 minutes.
Season with salt. Serve with rice.

ingredients.item: 1/2 cup Alavar sauce (a blend of coconut milk, spices, and shrimp paste)

instructions.step: Sauté onion and garlic in oil until fragrant.
Add curacha and cook for 5 minutes until slightly browned.
Pour in Alavar sauce, fish sauce, and coconut milk. Simmer for 20 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with rice.
Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger in oil until softened.
Add chicken and cook until browned.
Stir in soy sauce, vinegar, turmeric powder, and coconut milk. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Season with salt to taste. Serve with rice.
Grill or sear the pork and tuna cubes separately until cooked.
Mix the grilled meat with onion, garlic, vinegar, soy sauce, and chili flakes.
Serve as an appetizer or side dish.
Mix tuna with onions, tomatoes, vinegar, fish sauce, and chili flakes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve chilled.
In a pot, combine corn, sugar, coconut milk, and salt. Simmer for 20 minutes until thickened.
Transfer to a container and cool. Serve as a sweet snack.
Sauté onion and garlic in oil until softened.
Add beef cubes and cook until browned. Stir in soy sauce, turmeric, and water.
Simmer for 45 minutes until beef is tender. Stir in coconut milk and cook for another 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with rice.
Grill the plantain slices over medium heat until slightly charred and soft.
Brush with melted butter or margarine and sprinkle with brown sugar.
Serve hot as a sweet snack.
Sauté onion and garlic in oil until fragrant.
Add chicken and cook until browned.
Stir in soy sauce, vinegar, coconut milk, fish sauce, black pepper, and bay leaf.
Add water and simmer for 30 minutes until chicken is tender.
Serve with rice.
Mix grated coconut, sticky rice, sugar, and salt in a bowl.
Place the mixture in banana leaves and wrap into parcels.
Steam the parcels for 30 minutes or until cooked through.
Serve as a side dish or snack.
Mix rice flour, water, sugar, and salt in a bowl until smooth.
Add food coloring to the mixture if desired.
Pour the mixture into small molds lined with banana leaves.
Steam for 30 minutes or until firm.
Serve as a snack, especially during the Pahiyas Festival in Quezon.

ingredients.item: 2 cups sliced vegetables (carrots, cabbage, and snow peas)

instructions.step: Sauté onion, garlic, and pork in oil until browned.
Add shrimp, soy sauce, fish sauce, and vegetables. Cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in cooked rice noodles and pork liver (if using). Season with salt and pepper.
Serve with calamansi (or lime) and fried garlic on top.

ingredients.item: 1/2 cup vegetables (carrots, cabbage, and green beans)

instructions.step: Sauté onion, garlic, and pork in oil until browned.
Add shrimp, soy sauce, vinegar, and vegetables. Cook for 10 minutes.
Stir in cooked rice noodles and cook for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve with calamansi and fried garlic.
Sauté onion, garlic, and bay leaf in oil until fragrant.
Add crickets and cook for 10 minutes until crispy.
Pour in soy sauce, vinegar, and black pepper. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve with rice.

recipe.title: Betute (Frog Stuffed with Ground Pork - Pampanga)

instructions.step: Mix ground pork, onion, garlic, soy sauce, vinegar, black pepper, egg, and breadcrumbs.
Stuff the mixture into the frog’s body cavity.
Roll in flour and fry in hot oil until golden brown.
Serve hot with dipping sauce.
Mix chicken, peanuts, tomato sauce, soy sauce, masa, and coconut milk in a bowl.
Wrap the mixture in banana leaves and steam for 1 hour.
Serve hot as a savory snack or appetizer.
Sauté onion, garlic, and pork in oil until browned.
Add shrimp, soy sauce, vegetables, and stock. Cook for 10 minutes.
Stir in cooked noodles and cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve with fried garlic and calamansi.
In a large pot, sauté onion, garlic, and ginger in oil until fragrant.
Add beef shank and cook until browned.
Pour in fish sauce, soy sauce, calamansi juice, and beef broth. Bring to a boil.
Lower the heat and simmer for 1 hour or until beef is tender.
Stir in annatto powder, peppercorns, and lemongrass. Simmer for another 30 minutes.
Before serving, add saba banana and cook for 10 minutes more. Garnish with green onions.
Mix ground pork, tuba, soy sauce, sugar, garlic, salt, and black pepper in a bowl.
Stuff the mixture into the hog casing and tie the ends securely.
Steam the longganisa for 30 minutes until fully cooked.
Fry in oil until golden brown before serving.
Mix ground pork, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, sugar, black pepper, and salt in a bowl.
Stuff the mixture into hog casings and tie the ends securely.
Steam the longganisa for 30 minutes.
Fry in oil until crispy and golden brown.
Mix ground pork, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, paprika, black pepper, brown sugar, and salt in a bowl.
Stuff the mixture into hog casings and tie the ends securely.
Steam for 30 minutes.
Fry in oil until golden and crispy.
Mix ground pork, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, sugar, and black pepper in a bowl.
Stuff the mixture into hog casings and tie the ends securely.
Steam for 30 minutes.
Fry the longganisa in oil until golden brown.
Mix ground pork, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, sugar, and black pepper in a bowl.
Stuff the mixture into hog casings and tie the ends securely.
Steam for 30 minutes.
Fry in oil until golden and crispy.
Sauté onion, ground pork, and green peas in oil until browned.
Mix in grated potatoes, season with salt and pepper, and cook for 10 minutes.
Make dough by mixing flour, water, and salt. Roll it out into thin discs.
Place the filling in the center of the dough and fold to form a half-moon shape. Seal the edges.
Deep fry until golden brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels.
Sauté ground pork, longganisa, onion, and green peas in oil until cooked.
Mix flour, water, turmeric, salt, and pepper to make dough.
Roll out dough into discs, fill with pork mixture, and fold into half-moon shapes.
Deep fry until golden brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels.

ingredients.item: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, cabbage, green beans)

instructions.step: Sauté garlic, onion, and pork in oil until browned.
Add shrimp, soy sauce, vegetables, and stock. Cook for 10 minutes.
Stir in noodles and cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve with calamansi and fried garlic on top.
Sauté onion, garlic, and beef in oil until browned.
Pour in soy sauce, vinegar, tomato sauce, and water. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Season with pepper and serve hot.
Sauté garlic, onion, and pork in oil until browned.
Add shrimp and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in soy sauce, oyster sauce, and fish sauce. Add chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Add vegetables and cook for another 5 minutes.
Stir in pancit canton noodles and simmer until noodles are tender and broth is absorbed.
Grill pork or chicken until cooked, then slice into strips.
Wrap rice, grilled meat, and a fried egg in banana leaves.
Season with fish sauce, soy sauce, and black pepper before serving.
Dip oysters in flour, then in beaten egg, and coat with breadcrumbs.
Fry in hot oil until golden and crispy.
Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauce.
Season catfish with salt and pepper.
Dip in flour and coat with beaten egg.
Fry in hot oil until golden brown and crispy.
Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauce.
Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger in oil until fragrant.
Add snails and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk, fish sauce, soy sauce, sugar, black pepper, and water. Stir well.
Simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally until the sauce thickens.
Sauté garlic, onion, pork belly, and chicken liver in oil until cooked.
Season with soy sauce, vinegar, and chili flakes. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Transfer the mixture to a sizzling plate, crack an egg on top, and add mayonnaise.
Sizzle until the egg is cooked. Serve hot.
Sauté garlic, onion, and squid in oil until cooked.
Season with soy sauce, vinegar, and chili flakes. Cook for 5 minutes.
Transfer the mixture to a sizzling plate, crack an egg on top, and add mayonnaise.
Sizzle until the egg is cooked. Serve hot.
Sauté garlic and onion in olive oil until soft.
Add crabs and cook until they turn red.
Season with fish sauce, black pepper, vinegar, and soy sauce. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve hot with rice.
Boil chicken in water with onion, garlic, and ginger until tender.
Season with fish sauce, soy sauce, black pepper, and tamarind leaves (or paste).
Simmer for another 20 minutes. Serve hot.
Sauté garlic, onion, and chicken in oil until browned.
Add pineapple, soy sauce, coconut milk, green peas, and carrots. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.
Boil beef shank in water for 2 hours until tender, skimming off impurities.
Add onion, garlic, carrots, and potatoes. Continue to simmer until vegetables are tender.
Season with salt, pepper, soy sauce, and fish sauce. Serve hot with the marrow and broth.
Combine chicken, soy sauce, vinegar, onion, garlic, bay leaf, and peppercorns in a pan.
Simmer for 30 minutes until chicken is tender.
Pour in coconut milk and cook for an additional 10 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Season with salt to taste and serve hot.

ingredients.item: 1 lb chicken or pork (cut into parts)

instructions.step: Combine chicken or pork, soy sauce, vinegar, onion, garlic, bay leaves, and turmeric in a pot.
Simmer for 30 minutes until the meat is tender and the sauce thickens.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
Brown chicken in a pot with garlic and onion.
Add tomato sauce, liver spread, bell pepper, potatoes, and carrots. Stir well.
Pour in beef broth and simmer for 30 minutes until chicken is tender.
Add green peas and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.
Marinate pork steaks in soy sauce, vinegar, and black pepper for 30 minutes.
Sauté garlic and onion in oil until fragrant, then add pork steaks.
Pour in oyster sauce, water, and simmer for 20 minutes until pork is tender.
Season with salt and serve hot.
Fry tuna belly in oil until golden brown and cooked through. Set aside.
Sauté onion and garlic in the same oil.
Add fried tuna, mayonnaise, soy sauce, and chili flakes. Stir well and cook for 5 minutes.
Transfer to a sizzling plate and crack an egg on top. Serve hot.
Marinate tuna in vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, onion, and chili flakes for 15 minutes.
Add calamansi juice, salt, and pepper to taste. Mix well.
Serve chilled as an appetizer or main dish.
Marinate tuna steaks in soy sauce, calamansi juice, salt, and pepper for 30 minutes.
Sauté garlic and onion in oil until fragrant, then add marinated tuna steaks.
Cook for 10 minutes on each side until steaks are golden and cooked through.
Serve hot with rice.
Marinate chicken skin in vinegar, garlic, salt, and pepper for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan and fry chicken skin until crispy and golden brown.
Drain excess oil on paper towels. Serve hot as a snack or appetizer.
Fry tofu cubes until golden and crispy. Set aside.
Sauté garlic, onion, and tausi in oil until fragrant.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar. Stir well.
Add fried tofu and mix until well coated. Serve hot.
Sauté garlic, onion, pork, and shrimp in oil until cooked.
Add ubod and soy sauce, cook for 5 minutes, and season with pepper.
Allow the mixture to cool. Place in spring roll wrappers, fold, and seal with beaten egg.
Fry until golden brown. Serve hot with sweet and sour sauce.
Sauté garlic, onion, and ground meat until cooked.
Add carrots, green peas, salt, and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and allow to cool. Mix in the beaten eggs.
Form into patties and fry until golden brown on both sides. Serve hot.
Sauté garlic and onion in oil until fragrant.
Add young jackfruit, shrimp paste, and fish sauce. Stir for 5 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk and simmer for 20-30 minutes until the jackfruit is tender.
Season with salt and chili flakes. Serve hot with rice.

ingredients.item: 1 lb beef tripe (cut into small pieces)

instructions.step: Boil beef tripe in water for 1 hour until tender.
Sauté garlic, onion, and ginger in oil. Add boiled tripe and stir.
Add rice, soy sauce, fish sauce, and beef broth. Simmer for 30 minutes.
Season with pepper, and serve with hard-boiled eggs on top.
Boil pork belly for 45 minutes until tender.
Sauté garlic, onion, and shrimp paste in oil. Add boiled pork and soy sauce.
Add beef broth and simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve with noodles, boiled eggs, and chicharrón on top.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté garlic until golden brown.
Add rice and soy sauce. Stir well to coat the rice evenly.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve as a side dish with your main meal.
Combine salted eggs, tomatoes, and onion in a bowl.
Add fish sauce, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Toss to combine.
Serve as a side dish or appetizer.
Marinate galunggong in vinegar, soy sauce, salt, and pepper for 15 minutes.
Heat oil in a frying pan and fry galunggong until golden and crispy.
Serve hot with dipping sauce of choice.
Fry dilis in oil until crispy.
In a separate pan, sauté garlic, onion, and vinegar. Add fried dilis and cook for 5 minutes.
Season with chili flakes and salt. Serve hot.
Sauté garlic, onion, and shrimp in oil until cooked.
Add fish sauce and cook for 5 minutes. Add noodles and mix well.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve with garnished eggs and chicharrón on top.
Season the tilapia with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in a frying pan.
Fry the tilapia on both sides until crispy and golden brown.
Remove from oil, drain excess, and serve hot.

ingredients.item: 1 cup green papaya or sayote, sliced
Fish sauce and pepper to taste

instructions.step: Sauté ginger, onion, and tomato.
Add water and bring to a boil.
Add fish and green papaya; simmer until cooked.
Season with fish sauce and pepper. Add malunggay before serving.
Place all ingredients in a pot.
Bring to a boil without stirring.
Simmer until the fish is cooked and sauce is slightly reduced.
Serve hot with rice.
Boil water with ginger and onion.
Add fish and simmer until half cooked.
Add vegetables and cook until tender.
Season and serve hot.
Boil water with onion and tomato.
Add squash and string beans.
Simmer until vegetables are tender.
Stir in greens and season with fish sauce.
Sauté garlic and onion, then add shrimp or pork.
Add grated corn and water.
Simmer until thick.
Add greens and season before serving.
Mix pork with egg, onion, salt, and pepper. Wrap in molo wrappers.
Boil broth and drop dumplings one by one.
Simmer until wrappers are tender.
Garnish with fried garlic and onions before serving.
Sauté garlic, onion, and meat until browned.
Add noodles and a bit of broth or water.
Mix in sauces, vegetables, and cook until tender.
Serve hot with calamansi.

ingredients.item: Fried garlic and spring onion for garnish

instructions.step: Boil rice with water and ginger until porridge-like consistency.
Season and stir regularly to prevent sticking.
Top with egg, garlic, and onion before serving.

ingredients.item: 1/2 kg ground shrimp or crab meat

instructions.step: Mix seafood, coconut, onion, ginger, salt, and pepper.
Wrap mixture in taro leaves.
Arrange in a pot and pour in coconut milk.
Simmer for 30–40 minutes until tender and creamy.
Wrap seasoned fish with tomatoes, onions, and ginger in banana leaves.
Steam or grill until cooked through.
Marinate bangus in vinegar, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Fry until golden and crispy.
Mix ingredients to form a batter.
Let rise, then bake until golden.
Top with sugar or cheese.
Cook goat meat with spices and liver spread until tender.
Serve with rice.
Mix lato with vinegar, diced tomatoes, onions, and ginger.
Serve fresh.
Combine guso with vinegar and chopped vegetables.
Mix and serve chilled.
Fill coconut leaf pouches with rice and boil until fully cooked.
Serve as packed rice.
Marinate chicken in sauce mix.
Grill or pan-fry.
Simmer with sauce until glazed.
Cook pork with vegetables and tomato sauce until thick.
Serve with rice.
Coat shrimp in seasoned batter.
Deep-fry until golden.
Serve with dipping sauce.
Marinate pork in soy sauce, calamansi, garlic, and ketchup mixture.
Skewer and grill until cooked and slightly charred.
Marinate chicken in a sweet-savory sauce.
Skewer and grill until thoroughly cooked and smoky.
Stuff tilapia with tomatoes and onions.
Wrap in banana leaves and grill until cooked through.
Stuff squid with tomato-onion mix, marinate, and grill until tender.
Avoid overcooking to maintain tenderness.
Sauté garlic and crab fat in butter.
Mix in rice and stir-fry until evenly coated.
Add calamansi juice if desired.
Sauté garlic and bagoong, then mix in rice.
Serve with sliced green mango and tomatoes.
Fry peanuts with lots of garlic until golden.
Season with salt and let cool before serving.
Cook chocolate and plain glutinous rice mixtures separately.
Layer and roll in banana leaves, then steam.
Wrap glutinous rice soaked in coconut milk in banana leaves.
Tie and boil until cooked and sticky.
Sauté aromatics, add snails and coconut milk.
Simmer until cooked, then stir in chili leaves before serving.
stuff the fish with the ingredients
